law_indigenous_consultation.title: Duty of Prior Consultation (Constitution Art. 231 & ILO 169)
law_indigenous_consultation.summary: Brazil’s framework is constitutional + international, requiring FPIC (ILO 169) before mining in Indigenous Lands. Unlike Peru’s 2011 law, Brazil has no standalone statute, leaving gaps exploited by proposals like PL 1331/2022.
key_provisions: Congressional approval required for mining on Indigenous lands

icsid_cases.summary: Brazil has not ratified ICSID and avoids ISDS. No mining arbitration against Brazil.
Mercosur excludes ISDS; disputes resolved state‑to‑state. Consultation emphasized but arbitration avoided.
Internal conflicts over Yanomami mining; ~2,000 ANM requests blocked. Disputes handled domestically.

focus_analysis: Brazil parallels Peru on consultation but rejects ISDS. This reduces investor‑state litigation but heightens domestic conflict risk, especially Indigenous land disputes.
